publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1470 Aileen Campbell: Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates Gurjit Singh on his election as President of the National Union of Students Scotland; notes the contribution of the NUS and other student bodies to the successful campaign for abolition of the graduate endowment; believes that the NUS has an important role to play as a strong, independent voice for students in Scotland, and further believes that MSPs of all parties should continue to work closely with student representative bodies to ensure that the voice of students is heard in the Parliament.

S3M-1470 Aileen Campbell: Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates Gurjit Singh on his election as President of the National Union of Students Scotland; notes the contribution of the NUS and other student bodies to the successful campaign for abolition of the graduate endowment; believes that the NUS has an important role to play as a strong, independent voice for students in Scotland, and further believes that MSPs of all parties should continue to work closely with student representative bodies to ensure that the voice of students is heard in the Parliament. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn*, Bashir Ahmad*, Robert Brown*, Alasdair Allan*, Rob Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Sandra White*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-1470 Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland (lodged on 3 March 2008) Christine Grahame*, Bill Kidd*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-1470 Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland (lodged on 3 March 2008) Robin Harper*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-1470 Aileen Campbell: Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates Gurjit Singh on his election as President of the National Union of Students Scotland; notes the contribution of the NUS and other student bodies to the successful campaign for abolition of the graduate endowment; believes that the NUS has an important role to play as a strong, independent voice for students in Scotland, and further believes that MSPs of all parties should continue to work closely with student representative bodies to ensure that the voice of students is heard in the Parliament. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Bashir Ahmad, Robert Brown, Alasdair Allan, Rob Gibson, Alex Neil, Sandra White, Stuart McMillan, Christine Grahame, Bill Kidd, Joe FitzPatrick, Christina McKelvie, Robin Harper, Gil Paterson
S3M-1470 Congratulations to President-elect of NUS Scotland (lodged on 3 March 2008) Bob Doris*
